noun.description: A forked stick with an elastic band fastened to the two prongs, used by children for shooting small stones; a slingshot.

verb.description: Hurl or launch (something) in a specified direction with or as if with a catapult.
examples: the explosion catapulted the car 30 yards along the road
their music catapulted them to the top of the charts
the plane was refueled and catapulted back into the air again

origin: Late 16th century: from French catapulte or Latin catapulta, from Greek katapeltēs, from kata- down + pallein hurl.
